content.description: There are two cruxes. The first is moving past the first bolt. This second is the slab past the the second bolt.
content.protection: The route is a combinatin of bolts and trad protection. The pro is smaller pieces. The anchors are bolted.
content.location: This route is to the left of Caty'd Away. Start in the alcove. Go up to the first bolt. Straight up from the bolt is very dirty. Head right right to the flake. Continue right to the water mark. Follow the bolts to the right. This route crosses Cary'd Away at the flake.

content.description: Sustained 5.6 slab climbing up a pillar.   Can be accessed, on rope, by another set of anchors above.
content.protection: 3 bolts and a .75.  Can be led without gear but has some runnout.  Bolted anchors with rap rings.
content.location: Look for the long “detached” pillar sectioned by three horizontal cracks on it’s face.  The first and most recognizable route and feature when approaching the crag from the lower trail.

content.description: Scramble the bushy ramp to a detached boulder with a large horizontal crack at the base.  Make an exposed but solid high step on to the corner above the horizontal and  clip the first bolt. From here follow the boltline on small crystals and knobs to a bolted anchor at the top.   It’s possible to access this boulder from the top of ST1.  A protection bolt has been placed to protect the “scramble” up.
content.protection: 4 bolts, bolted anchor in a vertical line (only one with a rap ring). When rapping only the first anchor bolt is usable.
content.location: A large detached boulder in roughly the middle of the crag

climbs.name: Feel the Creep
climbs.fa: Jan Holdeman, Paul Paonessa, Eric Ramsey

content.description: Slippery friction climbing at it’s best. Crux between second and third bolt
content.location: The first large slab you come to when approaching from the lower trail.  Above some boulders and vegetation.  left of the large pillar “just fine”

content.description: Follow a slab up along a left leaning crack.  Pass a detached flake (seems very loose, tread carefully) to a horizontal seam.  Continue past the horizontal on the right side of the face to a large ledge.  Clip the “it just keeps going “ bolt in the middle of the face and finish on easier moves. *The first bolt is about 15 feet up an “easy” but exfoliating terrain.  A new or cautious lead might want a stick clip.   *Crux is above third bolt
content.protection: 6 quick draws, single rack from .5-#1. Can be done without gear but will have runnout.   Finish on bolted anchor with rap rings.
content.location: Right most climb at the crag. Look for the large, shallow, left leaning crack.  The base of the route has some exfoliating rock.

content.description: I thought the crux was at the transition to the main crack - there was a dusty shoot to clean and a med nut fit fine - but it was a dedicated move
content.protection: 3 bolts - 2 bottom and one to protect the headwall at the top
content.location: The Route is the first obvious line on the right of the trail that branches off from the North Side of Sven 2 - it usually in the sun because its easternly face.

content.description: Start on an exfoliating slab right of a mossy right leaning crack/flake.  Climb 15 feet and clip the first bolt.  Then continue straight up getting good gear under a horizontal crack.  Continue up to a small ledge with a good stance and get some gear in at your feet.  Ascend the face, on the left side over a small bulge clipping bolts as you go.  Get ready to work out the friction puzzle from the bulge bolt to the face bolt above.  After clipping, and exhaling your stress, continue up easier slab to the ledge with the “it keeps going” bolt.  Finish at the bolted anchors above.
content.protection: 6 bolts, single rack .5-#2.  Bolted anchor with rap rings.
content.location: Look for the exfoliating face and the right leaning mossy flake that begins the route.

content.description: Climb a thin face to a more mellow angle *the first clip is about 10 feet up and thin.  A stick clip is suggested for those not wanting to risk a groundfall.
content.location: Located in the middle of the exfoliating face right of the bushy gully next to birthday bash.

content.description: Start on the left side of the exfoliating face in the middle of the crag. (Look for the grey bolt about 25 feet up).  You’ll have a bushy lower angle gully to your left as you begin.  Make a few big steps to establish yourself on the face.   Tread generally up and right clipping bolts and placing a piece of protection.   The route rounds off and becomes lower angle as you climb.   *it’s possible to access the anchors by scrambling the bushy ramp below “fly by” , on the right side of the slab
content.protection: 2 bolts and a #1. Bolted anchor with rap rings.
content.location: Left side of the exfoliating face in the middle of the crag.  Right of a lower angle bushy gully.

content.description: One of three "Towers", Sven Slab 1 and 2 are located to the North just south of the Sven Slab formation.  Sven’s slab is sunny till mid afternoon; it’s a great crag to visit on a sunny winter day.
